column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=The day it rained in the garden
#Text=The first drops of rain fell onto the parched stones from a cloudless blue sky .
#Text=They disappeared immediately , drunk down into the mineral silence .
#Text=The garden paused , and everything held its breath and waited .
#Text=More rain would come .
#Text=Everyone knew , beyond belief or necessity that the time had come .
#Text=And with it , the rain .
#Text=Heavy oily drops bounced from leaf to grass to dusty ground , gathering in stems and folds on the way .
#Text=Yet still the sky was a hard polished blue with not a cloud in sight .
#Text=Still the garden held its breath .
#Text=It would not be long now .
#Text=A spattering of drops plucked memories from deep in the roots , shivering through shoots and tendrils , humus and stone .
#Text=Wispy vapour trails marbled the blue surface above .
#Text=And then it rained for good .
#Text=We sat on the porch watching , no longer daring to dart out and leap around in the downfall as drops turned to torrents and the staccato tapping on the roof climaxed to a thunderous roar .
#Text=Pools erupted and overflowed along the edges of the lawn , cascading around the raspberry canes and over the flower beds .
#Text=Earthworms rose up from the water - laden earth where they could no longer breath and wriggled and struggled fro air on the surface , writhing and swimming for a safe haven .

#Text=Water burst over the barrels and cans standing under the eaves and gutters , flooding the pathways , carrying away all that was n’t fixed solid and licking at the stairs to the back porch before climbing each step and lapping against the planks we were sitting on , a wooden raft surrounded by angry water and martial beat drum , drum , drumming on the roof above .

#Text=We slipped out feet over the sides and when we felt the fish , some as big as logs , some as small as leaves , nibble at our feet , we leant over to watch them fraying and frolicking under the choppy surface .
#Text=Waves lapped at the porch , washing away the boxes , and bowls , and the dog ’s basket .

#Text=The rocking chair , the watering can , boxes of cuttings , and tied - up newspapers , all floated away as we slammed the kitchen door shut and retreated to the front room we gazed out at the river that the street had become .
#Text=The sky was pewter smeared with charcoal now , and pressed down hard on the rooftops , slowly dissolving everything below .
#Text=When the water rippled into the hallway , we splashed our way to the staircase and then up as it nipped at our heels .

#Text=Outside the other houses were rocks surrounded by sea with mermaids swimming all around , flapping their scaly tails and hauling themselves up , to fall backwards into the crest of the oncoming waves .
#Text=And as they swam they sang , their voices born on the winds and the salt and the rain , and we could hear them singing , He is coming , He is coming .
#Text=And they combed their long hair in preparation .
#Text=We waved and called , and they laughed and played , tantalising , their seaweed locks just out of reach .
#Text=With a flick of the tail they were off , still singing , He is coming , He is coming , until their voices were lost in the noise of the rain and the water .
#Text=A great whiskered head arose , then a belly , wet and sleek , long enough to wrap itself twice around the world .
#Text=“ Is it him ? ” we asked each other , nudging elbows and climbing onto the chairs .
#Text=We pulled off wet socks and shoes , letting them float away on the tide , before the great worm turned and the wake engulfed the creaking , cracking house .
#Text=We clambered up onto the roof , sliding on the tiles and clinging to chimney stacks , sheltering our eyes from the driving downpour .
#Text=The sky was black , and the stormy sea all the deepest , darkest blues and greens and greys and flecked with white where the sea - horses galloped .

#Text=The waters broke making way for the gnarled head of a whale , spouting water high against the clouds before opening its whiskered maw and in a looming , booming voice called : He is coming , He is coming .

#Text=The chimneys washed away , so we scrambled onto the blue - black back encrusted with barnacles and cockles like stars in a night sky and held on tight as he rode the waves , dipping and blowing , dipping and blowing .
#Text=The wind and the rain tugged at our hair .
#Text=And still it rained .
#Text=We heard a fearsome creaking and cracking and before our eyes a great patch of sky peeled away , deeping down in the troughs and riding the crests with torn sails set against the wind .
#Text=It was a galleon with masts like a dead man ’s fingers , tarred timbers groaning and a mermaid sat on the bow as he ship dipped and passed .
#Text=He is coming , He is coming , she sang out .
#Text=And just as the wash hit us , prising us from the whale ’s speckled back and down into the sea , someone threw down a knotted rope and we hung on for dear life .
#Text=The singing sailors hauled us aboard chanting , He ’s a coming - ha ! He ’s a coming - ha !
#Text=And we fell onto the deck like fish bursting from a net .
#Text=The Captain stood above us dressed in jewels and finery from a thousand pillagings .
#Text=My mother is getting ready for school tomorrow .
